turns.content: Can you write again those 10 contextual nudges personalized for each different type of members of Anytime Fitness and their preferences. Its members typically range from young adults to middle-aged individuals, including students, professionals, and retirees. The club's hallmark is its convenience and accessibility, including extended hours of operation, worldwide access under a single membership, and smaller gym sizes that cater to busy and on-the-go lifestyles. Members who prefer a quieter environment with ample equipment have found home in Anytime Fitness. Others stay for the relationships and sense of community developed in a long-term routine with trainers and fellow club/gym-goers. Often, members come to the gym to improve overall health, achieve personal fitness goals, or maintain their existing level of fitness. Still, others seek social connection, group workouts such as the popular Zumba, Bootcamp, and HIIT classes that are taught in most locations. Create a table of those contextual nudges.

Here are the 10 contextual nudges personalized for different types of members of Anytime Fitness and their preferences:

| Nudge # | Young Adults/Students | Professionals | Retirees | Quieter Environment Seekers | Group Workout Enthusiasts |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Introduce affordable student membership plans and study-break workout suggestions in the welcome tour. | Highlight time-efficient workouts and extended hours in the welcome tour. | Showcase low-impact exercises and age-appropriate activities in the welcome tour. | Emphasize quieter hours and ample equipment during the welcome tour. | Feature popular group classes, such as Zumba, Bootcamp, and HIIT, in the welcome tour. |
| 2 | Send notifications about student discounts, study-break workouts, and events tailored to young adults. | Notify professionals of time-efficient workouts, peak hours, and work break exercise suggestions. | Inform retirees about low-impact exercises, senior-focused events, and age-appropriate activities. | Update quieter environment seekers about less busy hours and equipment availability. | Alert group workout enthusiasts about upcoming classes, schedules, and special events. |
| 3 | Display in-app banners promoting events for young adults, such as themed workout nights or social gatherings. | Feature banners for professionals, highlighting lunchtime classes and efficient workout routines. | Showcase banners for retirees with age-specific activities and low-impact exercise classes. | Present banners emphasizing equipment availability and quieter hours. | Advertise popular group classes and related community events in banners. |
| 4 | Offer workout routine suggestions tailored to young adults, including stress-relief exercises and campus fitness events. | Recommend time-efficient workouts and routines that fit professionals' busy schedules. | Suggest age-appropriate workouts and activities designed for retirees. | Provide suggestions for less crowded hours and equipment-focused workouts. | Propose group classes and social workout activities tailored to users' preferences. |
| 5 | Send reminders about student-focused events, group classes, or social gatherings they signed up for. | Remind professionals about upcoming lunchtime classes, after-work events, or personal appointments. | Notify retirees of upcoming age-appropriate events, classes, or social gatherings. | Update quieter environment seekers about less crowded hours and any upcoming equipment maintenance. | Alert group workout enthusiasts about upcoming class schedules and any changes. |
| 6 | Encourage young adults to share their workout achievements, events attended, and social connections on social media. | Motivate professionals to share their time-efficient workouts and fitness milestones. | Inspire retirees to share their age-appropriate workouts and social activities. | Prompt quieter environment seekers to share their workout routines and equipment-focused achievements. | Urge group workout enthusiasts to share their class experiences, achievements, and social connections. |
| 7 | Display event countdowns for student-focused events or group classes popular among young adults. | Showcase countdowns for lunchtime classes, after-work events, or goal-oriented challenges. | Highlight countdowns for age-specific events or group classes designed for retirees. | Emphasize countdowns for equipment maintenance or less crowded hours. | Present countdowns for group classes, special events, or community challenges. |
| 8 | Reward young adults with achievement badges for attending student-focused events or completing campus fitness challenges. | Give professionals badges for completing time-efficient workouts or attending lunchtime classes. | Award retirees with badges for participating in age-appropriate activities or low-impact exercises. | Grant badges to quieter environment seekers for achieving equipment-focused milestones. | Present group workout enthusiasts with badges for attending classes and engaging in social activities. |
| 9 | Use tooltips to provide helpful hints for young adults, such as study-break |  |  |  |  |

| Nudge # | Young Adults/Students | Professionals | Retirees | Quieter Environment Seekers | Group Workout Enthusiasts |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 9 | Use tooltips to provide helpful hints for young adults, such as study-break workout ideas or campus fitness resources. | Offer tooltips with time-management tips, efficient workout suggestions, and professional networking opportunities. | Provide tooltips with age-appropriate fitness advice, low-impact exercise ideas, and senior-focused resources. | Share tooltips with advice on quieter workout times, equipment usage tips, and peaceful workout routines. | Present tooltips highlighting group class schedules, popular workouts, and community-building tips. |
| 10 | Highlight progress toward fitness goals, stress-relief achievements, and social connections for young adults. | Emphasize progress toward time-efficient workouts, work-life balance, and fitness milestones for professionals. | Showcase progress toward age-appropriate workouts, health improvements, and social connections for retirees. | Display progress in equipment-focused workouts, quieter workout times, and personal fitness goals for quieter environment seekers. | Illustrate progress in group class participation, social connections, and fitness achievements for group workout enthusiasts. |

These contextual nudges take into account the diverse needs and preferences of different Anytime Fitness members, such as young adults, professionals, retirees, quieter environment seekers, and group workout enthusiasts. By personalizing the nudges, Anytime Fitness can create a more engaging and supportive experience tailored to each member's unique fitness journey.
Can you map the previous 10 contextual nudges for various members' type with the relative behavior change techniques - BCT?

Here's the mapping of the 10 contextual nudges for various members' types with the corresponding behavior change techniques (BCT):

| Nudge # | BCT | Young Adults/Students | Professionals | Retirees | Quieter Environment Seekers | Group Workout Enthusiasts |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Instruction on how to perform a behavior | Introduce affordable student membership plans and study-break workout suggestions in the welcome tour. | Highlight time-efficient workouts and extended hours in the welcome tour. | Showcase low-impact exercises and age-appropriate activities in the welcome tour. | Emphasize quieter hours and ample equipment during the welcome tour. | Feature popular group classes, such as Zumba, Bootcamp, and HIIT, in the welcome tour. |
| 2 | Prompts/cues | Send notifications about student discounts, study-break workouts, and events tailored to young adults. | Notify professionals of time-efficient workouts, peak hours, and work break exercise suggestions. | Inform retirees about low-impact exercises, senior-focused events, and age-appropriate activities. | Update quieter environment seekers about less busy hours and equipment availability. | Alert group workout enthusiasts about upcoming classes, schedules, and special events. |
| 3 | Social support (emotional) | Display in-app banners promoting events for young adults, such as themed workout nights or social gatherings. | Feature banners for professionals, highlighting lunchtime classes and efficient workout routines. | Showcase banners for retirees with age-specific activities and low-impact exercise classes. | Present banners emphasizing equipment availability and quieter hours. | Advertise popular group classes and related community events in banners. |
| 4 | Behavioral substitution | Offer workout routine suggestions tailored to young adults, including stress-relief exercises and campus fitness events. | Recommend time-efficient workouts and routines that fit professionals' busy schedules. | Suggest age-appropriate workouts and activities designed for retirees. | Provide suggestions for less crowded hours and equipment-focused workouts. | Propose group classes and social workout activities tailored to users' preferences. |
| 5 | Action planning | Send reminders about student-focused events, group classes, or social gatherings they signed up for. | Remind professionals about upcoming lunchtime classes, after-work events, or personal appointments. | Notify retirees of upcoming age-appropriate events, classes, or social gatherings. | Update quieter environment seekers about less crowded hours and any upcoming equipment maintenance. | Alert group workout enthusiasts about upcoming class schedules and any changes. |
| 6 | Social comparison | Encourage young adults to share their workout achievements, events attended, and social connections on social media. | Motivate professionals to share their time-efficient workouts and fitness milestones. | Inspire retirees to share their age-appropriate workouts and social activities. | Prompt quieter environment seekers to share their workout routines and equipment-focused achievements. | Urge group workout enthusiasts to share their class experiences, achievements, and social connections. |
| 7 | Salience of consequences | Display event countdowns for student-focused events or group classes popular among young adults. | Showcase countdowns for lunchtime classes, after-work events, or goal-oriented challenges. | Highlight countdowns for age-specific events or group classes designed for retirees. | Emphasize countdowns for equipment maintenance or less crowded hours. | Present countdowns for group classes, special events, or community challenges. |
| 8 | Reward (outcome) | Reward young adults with achievement badges for attending student-focused events or completing campus fitness challenges. | Give professionals badges for completing time-efficient workouts or attending lunchtime classes. | Award retirees with badges for participating in age-appropriate activities or low-impact exercises |  |  |
